title: Insurance Product Life Cycle Management for Life & Annuity
summary: The article discusses how insurance agencies need to manage changing customer life and annuity needs to maintain business relationships effectively.
green_innovation: FALSE. This article does not discuss any form of innovation focused on environmental sustainability.
business_innovation: TRUE. The article talks about adapting products and services to meet evolving customer needs, which aligns with the definition of business innovation.
green_product: FALSE. The article does not specifically mention any product designed, manufactured, and used to significantly reduce environmental impact throughout its life cycle.
green_process: FALSE. The article does not detail any methods or techniques in manufacturing, production, or operational activities aimed at minimizing environmental impacts and promoting sustainability.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 524210 - Insurance Agencies and Brokerages, 524113 - Direct Life Insurance Carriers, 524127 - Direct Title Insurance Carriers, 524128 - Other Direct Insurance (except Life, Health, and Medical) Carriers
greenwashing: FALSE. The article does not seem to involve any misleading statements about environmental benefits, indicative of greenwashing.

title: The Importance of Income Elasticity in Decision Making
summary: The article discusses how product life-cycle management involves adapting products as they age, possibly by diversifying the product line, adding new features, or finding new markets for the products.
green_innovation: FALSE: The article focuses on income elasticity and product life-cycle management without specifically highlighting environmental sustainability or reducing negative environmental externalities.
business_innovation: FALSE: The article discusses adapting products in response to market changes but does not focus on significant new or improved products or processes.
green_product: FALSE: The article does not specifically address the design, manufacturing, and usage of a product to reduce its environmental impact throughout its life cycle.
green_process: FALSE: The article mentions adapting products and finding new markets but does not focus on methods or techniques that minimize environmental impacts.
greenwashing: FALSE: The article does not mention any false or misleading environmental claims.

title: Managing the product and the process record: Benefits of using product life cycle
summary: The article discusses the importance of creating efficiencies within test and assembly processes to decrease manufacturing costs. It highlights the benefits of tying manufacturing process management to the product record and integrating product life-cycle management with manufacturing systems.
green_innovation: FALSE, The article focuses on manufacturing efficiencies and process management within the product development process, but it does not primarily address environmental sustainability goals.
business_innovation: TRUE, The article emphasizes the significance of improving test and assembly processes for decreased manufacturing costs, showcasing a new or improved business process.
green_product: FALSE, The text concentrates on enhancing manufacturing processes and management for better efficiency and cost reduction but does not specifically revolve around the design and use of a product that significantly reduces its environmental impact throughout its life cycle.
green_process: FALSE, The article primarily discusses improving manufacturing processes, particularly in test and assembly, for cost reduction and efficiency enhancement but not specifically focuses on minimizing environmental impacts or promoting sustainability.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 334118 - Computer Terminal and Other Computer Peripheral Equipment Manufacturing, 334413 - Semiconductor and Related Device Manufacturing, 334419 - Other Electronic Component Manufacturing, 334511 - Search, Detection, Navigation, Guidance, Aeronautical, and Nautical System and Instrument Manufacturing
greenwashing: FALSE, The article does not appear to engage in greenwashing as it mainly focuses on improving manufacturing processes and efficiencies rather than misleading environmental claims.
